adverbs.description: vainly (comparative vainlier or more vainly, superlative vainliest or most vainly)

entries.meaning: In a vain pursuit; to no avail.
examples: She searched vainly for her reflection in the shattered mirror.

entries.meaning: With a vain attitude; in a self-approving manner.
examples: She stared vainly at her reflection in the mirror.
